meanings.definition: To optimize something to a lesser degree than is possible.
meanings.sent1: I suboptimize my study time by watching TV instead of focusing on my homework.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to suboptimize your workout routine if you want to see results.
meanings.sent3: I suboptimize my morning routine by hitting the snooze button multiple times.
meanings.sent4: She suboptimized her chances of winning by not preparing for the competition.
meanings.sent5: Don't suboptimize your potential by settling for less than you deserve.

meanings.definition: To make something less effective or efficient by not optimizing it fully.
meanings.sent1: If you suboptimize your budget, you may run out of money before the end of the month.
meanings.sent2: It's easy to suboptimize your productivity by getting distracted by social media.
meanings.sent3: He suboptimized his chances of success by procrastinating on important tasks.
meanings.sent4: By suboptimizing their strategy, the team lost the game.
meanings.sent5: Don't suboptimize your efforts; give your best in everything you do.
